quest.name: Tears on the Sand
objectives: Speak with Alisaie at the Red Serai.
Speak with Alisaie in the Ocular.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Alisaie...

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I've spoken with the carers.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...Thank you. What you're doing, it...it means a lot to them. To me.

dialogue.name: WILLFORT
dialogue.text: ...Sorry to interrupt. We, uh... We realized we hadn't thanked you for rescuing Halric.

dialogue.name: WILLFORT
dialogue.text: ...You weren't hurt at all, were you?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text:
Hurt...? There wasn't even a fight. I was too late. Too slow.
And I thought I could protect you...

dialogue.name: CASSANA
dialogue.text: You can't blame yourself for things beyond your control. You brought Halric back safe and sound─no one could have done any more.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, but I've come to a decision: I won't be continuing in my role here.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I hope you will forgive me for leaving you...and that you will delay Halric's last meal for as long as you possibly can.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Not until it's too late, of course, just...give him what time you can.

dialogue.name: WILLFORT
dialogue.text: We always do.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Of course. She would have done the same.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Farewell, Halric. Keep Tesleen's words close to your heart.

dialogue.name: CASSANA
dialogue.text: Wait! You're leaving this very moment? I understand how you must feel, but surely this is a bit hasty? Do you even have anywhere to go?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I have a destination in mind, yes. And a purpose.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This damned Light, building without cease... It's the reason we can't save those corrupted by the eaters.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But what if we corrected the balance? Even if it were only little by little─even if it took years─it would surely make things better.

dialogue.name: WILLFORT
dialogue.text: Now, hold on there. Everyone knows there's too much Light, but how could you ever hope to get rid of it? You'd have to change the whole world!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That's right...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We should return to the Crystarium. I may not be able to repel the eaters on my own...but I can still use the skills I have gained here to hurt them.

dialogue.name: WILLFORT
dialogue.text: Poor Alisaie... She was so close to Tesleen... I only hope she doesn't do something foolish.

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: Forename! Good to see you again! You look like you've a story or two to tell... But I sense you'd sooner get back to the Crystarium.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename─I couldn't stay there a moment longer.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But I was serious about what I said. While the men and women at the Inn battle against this blight with kindness, I must fight it in my own way. With steel.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: From Eorzea's sword in the darkness...to Norvrandt's sword in the light?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Gods above. It feels like an age ago now...

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: Miss Alisaie!? ...Is there anything I can get you?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Your swiftest amaro! I need to return to the Crystarium─immediately!

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: A-As you wish!

dialogue.name: CASSARD
dialogue.text: Ah, it's good to be back. Mord Souq has many charms, but there's nothing like a proper bed to recover from a long journey...as I'm sure you'd agree.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Ugh, remind me to wear goggles if we ever fly over Amh Araeng again. I've barely gotten the sand out of my eyes.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...But the wind did help to clear my head at least.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I think I'm ready to meet with the Exarch. We need to talk about how we're going to wipe the sin eaters out. Shall we?

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: I see you were reunited with Alisaie, but I daresay you found little else to celebrate in Amh Araeng...

dialogue.name: MALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. You will have to share the tale of your journey once the two of you are suitably rested.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text:
Thank you for seeking me out, Forename─it meant a lot to have you there at my side.
...I was tempted to set off again the moment we had decided upon a direction, but you have still to visit Alphinaud, haven't you?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: And if I know my brother, he'll be on the cusp of discovering something vital to our success─if he hasn't already. I'm content to stay here and consider our options for the time being─but don't keep me waiting too long, eh?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Thank you for seeking me out, Forename─it meant a lot to have you there at my side. And looking at Alphinaud, I'd say he's as eager to begin this discussion as I am.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I say we lay our experiences before the Exarch, and step back to see what kind of picture they make. Then we can decide where to go from here.
